info.title: Release Server API
info.description: An application for managing your own release artifacts. The release server provides several REST endpoints for the following operations.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the uploaded artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the uploaded artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the uploaded artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the uploaded artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the uploaded artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the uploaded artifact.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the uploaded artifact.

schema.description: The version of the uploaded artifact.

artifact.description: The payload of the uploaded artifact (Zip file).

200.description: Upload of the artifact was successful.

400.description: No or invalid body provided (must be a Zip file).

401.description: The user is not authorized (wrong credentials or missing auth header).

get.summary: Retrieves a list of all available versions of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the searched artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the searched artifact.

200.description: An artifact with the specified product name exists.

404.description: The specified artifact does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves all available platforms for a specific artifact.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the artifact.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the artifact.

schema.description: The version of the artifact.

200.description: There are existing platforms for the specified product name.

404.description: The artifact does not exist or there exists no platform for the specified product name.

get.summary: Retrieves the release information of a specific artifact.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The version of the specified artifact.

200.description: The release information of the specified artifact exists.

404.description: The artifact with the specified product name does not exist. Therefore the release notes do not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves all available versions that are fitting to a specific product name / platform (HW architecture + OS).

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

200.description: There are existing versions for the specified platform and product.

404.description: There exists no version for the specified platform / product.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The version of the specified artifact.

200.description: There exists an artifact with the specified parameters.

404.description: There exists no artifact with the specified parameters.

get.summary: Retrieves the latest version of a specific artifact.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

200.description: The specified artifact exists (the ZIP file with the artifact will be retrieved)

404.description: The artifact is not available for the specified platform (OS + arch)

get.summary: Retrieves the latest version of a specific artifact.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

404.description:
The artifact is not available for the specified platform (OS + HW architecture)
            or the artifact with the specified product name does not exist

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The product name of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The operating system of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The hardware architecture of the specified artifact.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the specified artifact.

schema.description: The version of the specified artifact.

200.description: The specified artifact got deleted successfully.

401.description: The user is not authorized (wrong credentials or missing auth header).

404.description: There exists no artifact with the specified parameters.

delete.summary: Deletes all artifacts of a specific product name.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The product name of the artifacts, that have to be deleted.

schema.description: The product name of the artifacts, that have to be deleted.

200.description: All artifacts of the specified product name got deleted successfully.

401.description: The user is not authorized (wrong credentials or missing auth header).

404.description: There exists no artifact with the specified product name.

get.summary: Backups the whole artifact directory and retrieves it as a ZIP file.

200.description: The artifact directory backup was successful.

401.description: The user is not authorized (wrong credentials or missing auth header).
The user is not authorized (wrong credentials or missing auth header).

versionSuffix.description: Gets or sets the version suffix of the artifact (e.g. -alpha, -beta).

ProductVersion.description:
Provides the information of an artifact product version and implements several operations for
the ReleaseServer.WebApi.Models.ProductVersion.

platforms.description: Gets or sets the platforms, which are affected by the changes.

added.description: Gets or sets the added features of the release.

fixed.description: Gets or sets the issues, that have been fixed

breaking.description: Gets or sets the breaking changes of the release.

deprecated.description: Gets or sets the deprecated components.

ChangeSet.description: Provides the information of the code changes of a certain release.

changes.description: Gets or sets the code / product changes with this release (required).

ReleaseNotes.description: Provides the the release notes with all the changes.

identifier.description: Gets or sets the product identifier (product name) of the artifact.

os.description: Gets or sets the operating system of the artifact.

architecture.description: Gets or sets the hardware architecture of the artifact.

ProductInformation.description: Provides product information about a specific artifact.

productInformation.description: Gets the a list of product information for several artifacts.

ProductInformationList.description: Provides a list of product information for several artifacts.

platforms.description: Gets the available platforms for the corresponding artifact.

PlatformsList.description: Provides the information of the available platforms for a specific artifact.

releaseDate.description: Gets or sets the release date.

ReleaseInformation.description: Provides the structure of the release information

versions.description: Gets the available versions for the corresponding artifact.

ProductVersionList.description: Provides the information of the available versions of a specific artifact.

version.description: Gets the product version as string.

ProductVersionResponse.description: Defines the structure of the product version response body.

basic.description: Input your username and password to access this API
